page.title: 01BYFIELD/BODDINGTON AREA
page.content: OUR AREA IS MAINLY UNDULATING FARMLAND. IT IS DIVIDED BY HEDGEROWS AND FENCES. ONE OF THE MAIN FEATURES IN IT IS THE RESERVOIR,WHICH IS MAINLY USED FOR CANOEING,WINDSURFING AND YACHTING. ANOTHER FEATURE IS THE VILLAGE OF BYFIELD.IT HAS A 14TH. CENTURY CHURCH IN IT THAT IS STILL REGULARLY USED. THE SCHOOL IS MADE OF STONE AND WAS BUILT IN 1906.116 PUPILS ATTEND IT. THE HOUSES IN BYFIELD ARE MAINLY BRICK AND ARE QUITE MODERN.THERE ARE SOME HOUSES THOUGH,DATING BACK TO STUART TIMES.WE HAVE A WELL USED VILLAGE HALL AND THE PLAYING FIELDS AND TENNIS COURTS ARE ALSO VERY POPULAR.THERE IS ONLY ONE SCHOOL IN THE PARISH OF BODDINGTON.ABOUT 60 PUPILS ATTEND IT. BODDINGTON IS A SMALL PARISH WITH ONLY ABOUT 250 HOUSES IN IT.
